summary: This FBI 302 form documents an interview conducted on August 10, 2019, with a BOP nurse/medic regarding the response to Jeffrey Epstein's death at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on July 23, 2019. The nurse describes arriving at Epstein's cell, finding him unresponsive with a ligature around his neck, and the subsequent unsuccessful resuscitation efforts.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on the morning of July 23, 2019. The document details the medical response to his death.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) with a ligature around his neck. BOP guards were administering CPR when medical staff arrived. Resuscitation efforts, including AED use and epinephrine, were unsuccessful.

events.title: FBI Interview with BOP Nurse
events.description: An FBI investigator interviewed a BOP nurse/medic regarding the medical response to Jeffrey Epstein's death. The interview took place on the 9th floor outside the 'L' tier at the correctional facility.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York, New York, United States
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at approximately 0633 hours on July 23, 2019.
A BOP nurse/medic arrived at the cell at 0635 hours and observed guards administering CPR to Epstein.
The nurse detected no pulse or signs of life and attempted to use an Automated External Defibrillator (AED), but 'no shock' was advised.
Epstein was transported to the MCC's 2nd floor medical ward where he was intubated, given oxygen, and three rounds of epinephrine, but further AED attempts also advised 'no shock'.
The nurse stated that upon entering the cell, Epstein was lying parallel to the bunk bed with a ligature still around his neck.
